full.title: Global Settings
full.description: Global settings for all scenarios.

anyOf.description: Operate without hardware and simulate all buses completely. The time response of the measurement (time basis) is controlled internally.
Operate without hardware and simulate all buses completely. The time response of the measurement (time basis) is controlled by an external program.
Operate without hardware and simulate all buses completely. The simulation speed is provided through the property time-scaling-factor.

The measurement is slowed-down by this factor. For scaling factors between zero and one, the simulation is accelerated accordingly. For example, if you enter the value 0.1 the measurement is accelerated by a factor of 10.
Run the simulation as fast as possible. The simulation speed is not constant and depends on the performance of the computer and the load that is provoked by simulation.

full.title: Variables
full.description: List of variables to be used in this configuration file.

full.title: Functional mockup units
full.description: List of functional mockup units. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: FDX
full.description: FDX settings. Entry can be deactivated with when.

transport-layer.description: Protocol to be used as transport layer for the FDX protocol

port.description: Number of the UDP or TCP port to be used for the FDX protocol

description-files.description: List of XML files that describe which signals or variables are to be exchanged and the manner in which this is to occur (e.g., with regard to grouping). Each entry can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Logging Block
full.description: Configuration of the standalone logging block.

full.title: CAN Replay Blocks
full.description: List of CAN replay blocks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Scenarios
full.description: List of scenarios with the option to define / override variables or defines.
Absolute or relative path to a SIL Kit config file (.yaml or .json). Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Advanced logging configurations

full.title: CAN network
full.description: A Network using the CAN protocol taking part in a simulation.

application-channel.description: Index of the Application Channel. Each busytype should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 255. Value '0' is not allowed. Caution: CAN and CANFD share the Application Channels!

full.title: CANFD network
full.description: A Network using the CANFD protocol taking part in a simulation.

mode.description: Operation Mode setting (iso or non-iso Mode).

arbitration-baudrate.description: Baudrate for the arbitration phase of CAN FD in Baud.

data-baudrate.description: Baudrate for the data phase of CAN FD in Baud.

application-channel.description: Index of the Application Channel. Each busytype should provide consecutive indices. Starts counting at 1. Value between 1 and 255. Value '0' is not allowed. Caution: CAN and CANFD share the Application Channels!

full.title: CAN replay block
full.description: A replay block for the CAN protocol.
Global configuration for the TCP/IP stack.

selected-stack.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided

anyOf.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. (use 'canoe' if settings should be manually provided)

selected-stack.description: If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used. If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided

anyOf.description: If set to canoe, a custom configuration can be provided. (remove other elements for option operating-system)

full.description: List of defines to be passed to capl / vcdl.
Define to be passed to capl / vcdl.
Absolute or relative path to a vsysvar file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a source file of a simulation node.  Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the defining configuration file.
Absolute or relative path to a vmodule file. Relative path specifications are resolved relative to the configuration file.
Simulation node configuration for the TCP/IP stack.

selected-stack.description:
If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used.
 If set to canoe, the configuration on the global level is used (this requires globals-settings/ethernet-settings/tcp-ip-stack/selected-stack to be set to canoe).
 If set to individual, a custom configuration can be provided

If set to operating-system, the machines configuration is used.
 If set to canoe, the configuration on the global level is used (this requires globals-settings/ethernet-settings/tcp-ip-stack/selected-stack to be set to canoe).
 If set to individual, a custom configuration can be provided

full.title: Timing conditions
full.description: Timing conditions for a replay block.

condition.description: The condition when the replay shall start.

anyOf.description: The first event of the replayed file occurs with measurement start.
The original timestamp of the replayed file are used.
The first event is delayed. Can be configured by the 'delayed-ms' element.

delay-ms.description: The delay in ms if the condition 'delayed' is selected. No effect otherwise.

full.description: Activates the TCP Delayed Ack Option.
Time To Live.

IPv6-Address of the Gateway

full.title: Version
full.description: Json schema version for the vEnvironment configuration file. Acceptance criteria: equal major version, less/equal minor and patch version.

full.title: Include files
full.description: Include a different file (similar to #include of the c preprocessor). The order of includes does not matter. Circular / multiple includes are resolved correctly.

full.title: Application Models
full.description: List of application models representing some program. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Datasources
full.description: The definition of datasources used by application models. Input files can be deactivated with when.

full.title: SIL Kit
full.description: SIL Kit settings. Entry can be deactivated with when.

participant-name.description: Name used by CANoe4SW to join a simulation as a participant at the start of a measurement.

simulation-step-in-micro-sec.description: Time length of a single simulation step. Valid only for the time-source "external-software". Default: 100 us.

life-cycle-event-timeout-in-sec.description: Maximum waiting time for the other simulation participants. Valid only for the time-source "external-software". Default: 30s.

full.description: List of defines to be passed to capl / vcdl. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.description: List of Ethernet networks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

full.title: Ethernet Replay Blocks
full.description: List of ethernet replay blocks. Entries can be deactivated with when.

access-mode.description: Mode of the underlying Ethernet bus. Classic approach is the 'Channel-based' setup.       More recent and recommended mode is the switched 'Network-based' mode (port based).

signal-updates.description: Specifies how signals are updated on Network-based access. Will be ignored on Channel-based setups. Always: Events of all ports are used to update a signal without qualified ethernet port. rx-only: Only packets received by the interface are used, which leads to less duplicated updates. never: Signals without qualified ethernet ports are not updated.

anyOf.description: Events of all ports are used to update a signal without qualified ethernet port.
Only packets received by the interface are used, which leads to less duplicated updates.
Signals without qualified ethernet ports are not updated.

full.title: Channel mapping
full.description: The channel mapping for a replay block.

default-mapping.description: The default mapping of a channel if it is not explicitly mapped.

anyOf.description: The channel is mapped to itself if there is an active network.
The channels are ignored by default.

mappings.title: Explicit mappings
mappings.description: The explicitly mapped channels. Overwrites the default mapping for the source.

anyOf.title: Map source channel
anyOf.description: Mapping from application channel of the replay file to a target network.

source-channel.description: The source application channel from the replayed file.

anyOf.title: Map source network
anyOf.description: Mapping from a named source network of the replay file to a named target network.

source-network.description: The source network name. Only works if the replay file was created by CANoe and contains the relevant metadata.

anyOf.title: Ignore source channel
anyOf.description: Ignores an application channel of the replay file.

anyOf.title: Ignore source network
anyOf.description: Ignores a named source network of the replay file.

ignore-source-network.description: The ignored source network name. Only works if the replay file was created by CANoe and contains the relevant metadata.
